attributes.comment:
As an Adoptive parent I am very concerned about the rise in fees for us.
Because we must often apply twice the rise is actually 140% here's why...
Here is what it costs to file with USCIS for a couple just to adopt:

What it used to be when adoptions took place within 18 months:

I600A: $545

Fingerprints: $70 x 2 = $140

Total: $685

What it will be now that adoptions are taking longer plus the increase:

I600A: $670 x 2 = $1340

Fingerprints: $80 x 4 = $ 320

Total: $1660

That's an increase of $975 or over 140%! That's how much more USCIS will
make on just us, adopting parents, with no increase in services.

And that's not even taking into consideration the fact that applying for our
children's Certificate of Citizenship (for IR4 visas) goes from $215 to
$460, a difference of $245 or about 120% increase. Sometimes, we don't even
get the certificates for a year after filing!

This is absurd! I hope you all can figure out a better way to fund our
government. When you are lowering taxes for the top 10% of the US income
population, it seems a bit odd that these fees are rising by so much!

Thank you for listening....one of many concerned middle income adoptive parents
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Susan Kask
